limitations.description: The study is limited to only one dataset, the Kaggle Credit Card Fraud Detection Dataset, which may not be indicative of other datasets or real-world scenarios.
limitations.impact: Results may not generalize well to other types of data or domains beyond credit card fraud detection.

limitations.description: The use of SHAP for feature selection adds a distinct step in the process and requires more computational resources compared to built-in feature selection methods.
limitations.impact: This additional computational expense might make SHAP less practical for large datasets or real-time applications.

limitations.description: The comparison is limited to specific classifiers and does not include other possible models that could affect the outcome of the feature selection methods.
limitations.impact: The findings might not be applicable to other types of classifiers which were not studied in this paper.

limitations.description: SHAP values may vary when different trained models are utilized, leading to variability in rankings and results.
limitations.impact: The reliability and consistency of SHAP rankings across different model runs can affect the interpretation and use of selected features.

suggested_future_work: Explore these two feature selection methods across diverse application domains to assess their generalizability and effectiveness beyond credit card fraud detection.
conflict_of_interests: The authors declare that they have no competing interests.
